Class DateComponent

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.component.ComponentImpl
      • net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.component.Container
        • net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.component.composite.DateComponent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PropertyChangeListener, Iterable<Component>, EventListener, net.proteusframework.core.locale.LocaleContextSource, Component, DateEditingComponent, ListCellRenderer, ParentComponent, TableCellRenderer, TreeCellRenderer

    public class DateComponent
extends Container
implements DateEditingComponent
    Component for holding a Date.
    Author:
    Russ Tennant (russ@i2rd.com)

        endYear - the end year.
        parts - The parts of the date to display, a collection of DateComponentPart objects.

      • getFixedTimeZone

        public TimeZone getFixedTimeZone()
        Get the time zone to use for this component. If this method returns null then the session time zone will be used.
        Returns:
        TimeZone or null.

      • getTimeZone

      • init

        public void init()
        Description copied from interface: Component

        Called when a Component is first attached to a WindowManager. This means the Component should have valid return values from getApplication(), getLocaleContext(), getParent(). It is preferable to have all construction of the Component go here since a valid LocaleContext, Application object, etc., are available.

        When overriding this method, be sure to call the super class init(). init() is called only once for each Component. The parent component will have been init()ed before init() is called.

        NOTE: Do not call this method from application code. It is meant to be called by the WindowManager only.

        Specified by:
        init in interface Component
        Overrides:
        init in class ComponentImpl

      • isAllPartsSelected

        public boolean isAllPartsSelected()
        Returns true if all configured (in constructor) parts are selected.
        Returns:
        true if all parts selected, false if one or more configured parts is not selected.

      • isAnyPartSelected

        public boolean isAnyPartSelected()
        Return true if any date part is selected.
        Returns:
        true or false.

      • isShowMonthNumber

        public boolean isShowMonthNumber()
        Get if the month number is shown in the month selection.
        Returns:
        true if the month number is shown, false otherwise. Defaults to false.

      • setDate

        public void setDate(Date date)
        Sets the date to be displayed. This may set the wrong information if called before the component has been initialized. If date is null, clears the selection.
        Specified by:
        setDate in interface DateEditingComponent
        Parameters:
        date - the date.

      • setShowMonthNumber

        public void setShowMonthNumber(boolean showMonthNumber)
        Set if the month number is shown in the month selection.
        Parameters:
        showMonthNumber - true to show the month number.

      • setUnselectedLabel

        public void setUnselectedLabel(DateComponentPart part,
                      net.proteusframework.core.locale.TextSource label)
        Sets the label on the date component part combo box when a selection has not been made.
        Parameters:
        part - the part.
        label - the label may be null. A null value will remove any previously set label.

        public void setUseLayoutConstraints(boolean useLC)
        Set whether layout constraints should be used or not. Must be called before init() to take effect.
        Parameters:
        useLC - true if layout constraints should be used
